TopicTitle: What game mode do you prefer?

Articles.Content: Simple question, do you prefer science mode, creative, or career mode. I personally like science mode since you don't have to grind for funds, but still, have a reason to explore. But, I do have a career mode save that I spend some time on. Here's a strawpoll: https://www.strawpoll.me/15930468.
For reasons I don't understand, I just can't get into science mode the way I can career.  I use sandbox mostly for testing new designs, but otherwise all career.
Didn't we just do this last week?

1 hour ago, MDZhB said:

Career/science mode doesn't really appeal to me. Maybe once I get a little better at the game I'll want more challenge

That's what I did.  A lot of people recommend starting on science to avoid getting overwhelmed by all the parts choices, but it worked pretty well for me starting on sandbox to learn how to do stuff before adding in having to gather science & money

I usually prefer to play in science mod. I can’t really get into career mode because I enjoy exploring the Kerbol System for the pursuit of SCIENCE! while having all the parts and buildings unlocked. The process of getting said parts through science is also fun. However, I find the complexities of career mode - budget, finances, contracts, reputation, etc - to be a bit too daunting for me. I’m hoping to one day make a main career mode save to play through. Speaking of these main saves, I have one in science mode that I’ve been playing since version 1.2 or 1.3, and I’m hoping it will work in 1.4 (I know that my sandbox saves work, so I’m hoping it will be the same for the science save).

I also often play in sandbox mode if I’m bored with serious mission planing and large-scale projects. After weeks of taking the game seriously, it’s a breath of fresh air to spaghettify Kerbals, summon the Kraken, and build eight kilometer long death lasers (don’t ask).

8 hours ago, MDZhB said:

I always play sandbox. Career/science mode doesn't really appeal to me. Maybe once I get a little better at the game I'll want more challenge.

This ^
Sandbox mode. I'm the kind of KSP player who much more enjoys making and adding to mods than casually enjoying them. I usually get all my fun from seeing my inventions work right out of the SPH.

Career mode for me, and Im still on my first run. I find the contracts and the managing part of the game very interesting, always keeps me busy and forces me to make ships for specific missions or under certain budget.  

For example, I made a nice ship to land on Mun, Minmus and return to Kerbin, costs 380K.  After a botched mission, I was left with 290K, a crew stranded on Minmus and a rescue contract on the Mun, wich I needed to do to get money.   If I was playing sandbox I wouldnt have changed the original prototype, but Career forced me to make a barebones version, (almost no electric charge, no comms, tiny landing gear, budget life support, no lights, ports or extra fuel, no RCS, no fancy solar panels, no heat shields, no autopilot, minimal reaction wheels, etc.).

I wouldnt have had that challenge in Sandbox. Shaving 100K out of a ship that I already thought was balanced.

I always go career, but I never have funding issues, never take a contract for the money, and I mod my tech tree so's I have to go far, far out into the solar system to complete it...

On the whole I should probably go science in 1.5.

(But I'm way too far into the game to change now. I'll just continue making all my money from exploration contracts and world firsts...)

I do science because it is fun getting SCIENCE!TM while having all the buildings unlocked. I also do sandbox, in which i sometimes teleport to, say, Thelai, and try to land on it for no reason. and then i teleport my 10km cube into orbit.
I've dabbled in career and science, but I find sandbox the most fun.
Sandbox. Because I can set my own mission goals. And if you need ideas, I have a lot of them I can share.
Depending on what kind of mood I'm in, I'll usually play either career or sandbox. I don't think I've touched science mode since 0.90 was still the latest version...
